introduction.p: Impulse and momentum provide another way to study change in motion over time. They are specially useful in situations where change occurs over a short duration such as during a collision or upon an impact or during varying mass. In many respect, these concepts provide a more complete picture of dynamics than you learn by applying \vec F = m \vec a.
In this chapter, you will learn momentum techinques systematically, including integral form of Newton's second law of motion, the concept of center of mass, and principle of conservation of momentum.
